title: Active Equities to Watch in the Technology Sector -- Amkor Technology, Fairchild Semiconductor Intl., Lattice Semiconductor, Qlogic, and Applied Micro Circuits
content:
SOURCE www.erionline.net

NEW YORK 

Equity Research Institute has initiated coverage on the following equities: Amkor Technology Inc. (NASDAQ: AMKR), Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc. (NASDAQ: FCS), Lattice Semiconductor Corporation (NASDAQ: LSCC), QLogic Corporation (NASDAQ: QLGC), and Applied Micro Circuits Corporation (NASDAQ: AMCC). Free research report on Amkor Technology can be accessed at https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=AMKR On Tuesday, September 15, 2015 Amkor Technology Inc.'s stock finished Tuesday's session 0.38% higher at $5.31 https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=AMKR On Tuesday, shares in Fairchild Semiconductor International Inc. ended the session 0.29% higher at $13.66 https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=FCS Lattice Semiconductor Corp.'s stock lost 1.47%, to close the day at $4.03 https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=LSCC On Tuesday, shares in QLogic Corp. recorded a trading volume of 0.67 million shares, lower than their three months average volume of 1.27 million shares. The stock ended the day 0.19% higher at $10.37 https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=QLGC Applied Micro Circuits Corp.'s stock edged 0.69% higher, to close Tuesday's session at $5.81 https://www.erionline.net/reports?keyword=AMCC

--

About Equity Research Institute: Equity Research Institute ("ERI") produces regular sponsored and non-sponsored reports, articles, stock market blogs, and popular investment newsletters covering equities listed on NYSE and NASDAQ and micro-cap stocks. ERI has two distinct and independent departments. One department produces non-sponsored analyst certified content generally in the form of press releases, articles and reports covering equities listed on NYSE and NASDAQ and the other produces sponsored content (in most cases not reviewed by a registered analyst), which typically consists of compensated investment newsletters, articles and reports covering listed stocks and micro-caps.
